verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
I have heard <S%H8085><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> such things: <S%H428><s%> miserable <S%H5999><s%> comforters <S%H5162><s%> are ye all. <S%H3605><s%>
Shall vain <S%H7307><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> have an end? <S%H7093><s%> or <S%H176><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> emboldeneth <S%H4834><s%> thee that <S%H3588><s%> thou answerest? <S%H6030><s%>

I <S%H595><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> could speak <S%H1696><s%> as ye do: if <S%H3863><s%> your soul <S%H5315><s%> were <S%H3426><s%> in my soul's stead, <S%H8478><s%> <S%H5315><s%> I could heap up <S%H2266><s%> words <S%H4405><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you, and shake <S%H5128><s%> mine <S%H1119><s%> head <S%H7218><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> you.
But I would strengthen <S%H553><s%> you with <S%H1119><s%> my mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and the moving <S%H5205><s%> of my lips <S%H8193><s%> should assuage <S%H2820><s%> your grief.

Though <S%H518><s%> I speak, <S%H1696><s%> my grief <S%H3511><s%> is not <S%H3808><s%> assuaged: <S%H2820><s%> and though I forbear, <S%H2308><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> <S%H4480><s%> am I eased? <S%H1980><s%>
But <S%H389><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> he hath made me weary: <S%H3811><s%> thou hast made desolate <S%H8074><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my company. <S%H5712><s%>

And thou hast filled me with wrath, <S%H7059><s%> which is <S%H1961><s%> a witness <S%H5707><s%> against me: and my leanness <S%H3585><s%> rising up <S%H6965><s%> in me beareth witness <S%H6030><s%> to my face. <S%H6440><s%>

He teareth <S%H2963><s%> me in his wrath, <S%H639><s%> who hateth <S%H7852><s%> me: he gnasheth <S%H2786><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me with his teeth; <S%H8127><s%> mine enemy <S%H6862><s%> sharpeneth <S%H3913><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> upon me.

They have gaped <S%H6473><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me with their mouth; <S%H6310><s%> they have smitten <S%H5221><s%> me upon the cheek <S%H3895><s%> reproachfully; <S%H2781><s%> they have gathered themselves <S%H4390><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me.
God <S%H410><s%> hath delivered <S%H5462><s%> me to <S%H413><s%> the ungodly, <S%H5760><s%> and turned me over <S%H3399><s%> into <S%H5921><s%> the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>

I was <S%H1961><s%> at ease, <S%H7961><s%> but he hath broken me asunder: <S%H6565><s%> he hath also taken <S%H270><s%> me by my neck, <S%H6203><s%> and shaken me to pieces, <S%H6327><s%> and set me up <S%H6965><s%> for his mark. <S%H4307><s%>

His archers <S%H7228><s%> compass me round about, <S%H5437><s%> <S%H5921><s%> he cleaveth <S%H6398><s%> my reins <S%H3629><s%> asunder, and doth not <S%H3808><s%> spare; <S%H2550><s%> he poureth out <S%H8210><s%> my gall <S%H4845><s%> upon the ground. <S%H776><s%>
He breaketh <S%H6555><s%> me with breach <S%H6556><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> breach, <S%H6556><s%> he runneth <S%H7323><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me like a giant. <S%H1368><s%>
I have sewed <S%H8609><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> my skin, <S%H1539><s%> and defiled <S%H5953><s%> my horn <S%H7161><s%> in the dust. <S%H6083><s%>
My face <S%H6440><s%> is foul <S%H2560><s%> with <S%H4480><s%> weeping, <S%H1065><s%> and on <S%H5921><s%> my eyelids <S%H6079><s%> is the shadow of death; <S%H6757><s%>
Not <S%H3808><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> any injustice <S%H2555><s%> in mine hands: <S%H3709><s%> also my prayer <S%H8605><s%> is pure. <S%H2134><s%>
O earth, <S%H776><s%> cover <S%H3680><s%> not <S%H408><s%> thou my blood, <S%H1818><s%> and let my cry <S%H2201><s%> have <S%H1961><s%> no <S%H408><s%> place. <S%H4725><s%>
Also <S%H1571><s%> now, <S%H6258><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> my witness <S%H5707><s%> is in heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and my record <S%H7717><s%> is on high. <S%H4791><s%>
My friends <S%H7453><s%> scorn <S%H3887><s%> me: but mine eye <S%H5869><s%> poureth out <S%H1811><s%> tears unto <S%H413><s%> God. <S%H433><s%>
O that one might plead <S%H3198><s%> for a man <S%H1397><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> God, <S%H433><s%> as a man <S%H1121><s%> <S%H120><s%> pleadeth for his neighbor! <S%H7453><s%>
When <S%H3588><s%> a few <S%H4557><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> are come, <S%H857><s%> then I shall go <S%H1980><s%> the way <S%H734><s%> whence I shall not <S%H3808><s%> return. <S%H7725><s%>
